item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Kingspan Group Logo Kingspan Group plc is a building materials company based in Ireland trading in over 70 countries with 159 factories employing over 15,000 people. The company operates with five divisions; Insulated Panels, Insulation, Light & Air, Water & Energy, and, Data & Flooring. Source
You can download theKingspanlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >

item.description: Kingspan Group plc is a building materials company based in Ireland trading in over 70 countries with 159 factories employing over 15,000 people. The company operates with five divisions; Insulated Panels, Insulation, Light & Air, Water & Energy, and, Data & Flooring. Source

<! [CDATA[
Toolstation Logo Toolstation is a multi-channel retailer of tools and building materials. It has more than 470 branches in the UK, 65 in the Netherlands and 23 in France. It was bought by Travis Perkins in 2014. The managing director is James Mackenzie. Source
You can download theToolstationlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Toolstation
item.description: Toolstation is a multi-channel retailer of tools and building materials. It has more than 470 branches in the UK, 65 in the Netherlands and 23 in France. It was bought by Travis Perkins in 2014. The managing director is James Mackenzie. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Lafarge Tarmac Logo
Tarmac is a British building materials company headquartered in Solihull, England. The company was formed as Lafarge Tarmac in March 2013, by the merger of Anglo American’s Tarmac UK and Lafarge’s operations in the United Kingdom. In July 2014, Anglo American agreed to sell its stake to Lafarge, to assist Lafarge in its merger with Holcim and allay competition concerns. Prior to 1999, Tarmac Plc was an aggregates to construction company dating from 1903.
You can download theLafarge Tarmaclogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Lafarge Tarmac
item.description: Tarmac is a British building materials company headquartered in Solihull, England. The company was formed as Lafarge Tarmac in March 2013, by the merger of Anglo American’s Tarmac UK and Lafarge’s operations in the United Kingdom. In July 2014, Anglo American agreed to sell its stake to Lafarge, to assist Lafarge in its merger with Holcim and allay competition concerns. Prior to 1999, Tarmac Plc was an aggregates to construction company dating from 1903.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Compagnie de Saint-Gobain S.A. Logo
Compagnie de Saint-Gobain S.A. is a French multinational corporation, founded in 1665 in Paris and headquartered on the outskirts of Paris, at La Défense and in Courbevoie. Originally a mirror manufacturer, it now also produces a variety of construction and high-performance materials. The company is a component of the Euro Stoxx 50 stock market index. Source
You can download theSaint-Gobainlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
